translation.en: The whole place is full.
Thank you for coming. Thank you so much.
Thank you.
Thank you very much.
[in Yoruba] Hey! Is that you?
My dear friend.
[in English] Okay. Thank you, thank you.
Thank you, my darling. Thank you.
[in Yoruba] I hope she's not stressing you all out?
-Not at all. -Are you sure? [laughing]
Thank you.
How are you? Thank you for coming.
My dear Eni!
It is a lie, you made it. Thank you.
Happy birthday to you.
-Thank you so much. -Congratulations, eh?
Thank you, thank you.
[in Yoruba] Dani Cashi himself.
No shaking.
-Alhaji. -Eni-Baby.
[in Yoruba] I can't believe this! Just for me?
translation.ko: 믿기지가 않네 나 때문에 온 거야?

translation.en: You are welcome.
Good to see you. Thank you very much.
[in Yoruba] Please be seated. Don't get up.
[in English] The Justice is here.
[man] Congratulations.
Thank you, sir. Thank you very much. Thank you.
-No, sir. -Mm-mmm.
Mm-mmm. Mm-mmm.
I have to.
-Ah. -Or I'll take it as a big insult.
So, so grateful.
-It's nothing. -Thank you.
Thank you, sir.
What are you drinking?
No, no, no, no, sir.
Go to the back of the cupboard,
and bring that special drink to this table.
No problem.
-Thank you very much. -Thank you very much, sir.
Thank you, sir.
At this moment... Oh, wow!
Please permit me to honorably announce the arrival of the man of the people,
translation.ko: 영광스럽게도 제가 이분이 오신 걸 알려드리게 됐네요

translation.en: the man who has enjoyed so much support from the women,
Nigeria's favorite politician, the governor,
His Excellency, Chief Akinwale Razak Onikoyi.
Please, can we make the applause louder?
Eni-Baby, I hope I'm not too late.
Not at all, sir, you made it.
I had to leave a very important council meeting to be here on time.
translation.ko: 여기 오려고 중요한 회의도 박차고 나왔어요

translation.en: Thank you very much. I'm honored, please come along.
-Please come, thank you. -After you.
Please, can we make your applause louder for His Excellency one more time?
translation.ko: 각하를 위해 한 번만 더 크게 손뼉 쳐주시죠

translation.en: His Excellency, my governor, the MC is saying hello, sir.
That's my governor. [chuckles]
Please, a quick announcement.
Uh, please, if you are not here bearing gifts for the celebrant,
translation.ko: 혹시 선물을 안 가져온 분이 이 자리에 계신다면

translation.en: please stop going to the buffet stand, please.
Don't go there, please.
And right now, please permit me to welcome to the microphone
one of the most respected music legends out of the country of Nigeria.
translation.ko: 나이지리아에서 가장 존경받는 음악계의 살아있는 전설

translation.en: When it comes to Fuji music, he is king.
Please let's welcome King Wasiu Ayinde Marshal
popularly known as K1 The Ultimate.
As he does a special birthday song for the celebrant.
translation.ko: 오늘 생일의 주인공을 위해 특별한 곡을 부르신다고 하니

translation.en: Please can we make the applause louder?
[Singing in Yoruba] ♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ As you grow older May your life be more fulfilled ♪
♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ As you grow older May your life be more fulfilled ♪
♪ To the dear celebrant ♪
♪ Eni, go and get your groove on ♪
♪ Can you hear what I am saying? ♪
♪ To the celebrant for the day ♪
♪ Happy birthday to you ♪
♪ Eni, may you live long on earth ♪
♪ May you live long on earth ♪
♪ Can you hear what I am saying? ♪
♪ Eni, if your feet can dance ♪
Waiter! Come, come.
-Where's my food now? -It's coming, ma.
I ordered Amala, Gbegiri and Ewedu.
It's coming, ma. Right now.
"It's coming, It's coming." You've been saying that since--
[in Yoruba] When are you going to bring the food?
When I've lost my appetite?
Or what kind of rubbish is this?
Just take a look at our friend.
translation.ko: 그러지 말고 우리 친구 좀 봐

translation.en: Ah, ageless mama. See her skin glowing.
translation.ko: 나이도 안 드네 피부에서 광이 난다

translation.en: [in Yoruba] What? Whose skin is glowing?
This useless one that has bleached her entire life away
translation.ko: 저기 쓸모없고 과거는 싹 세탁한 데다

translation.en: and looks like a Gambian turkey?
[in English] Look at her, always acting like a pussycat.
Meanwhile all her teeth are made of razor blades.
[in Yoruba] This useless thing.
[in Pidgin] Don't come here to eat this woman's food,
translation.ko: 생일 파티에 와서 쟤가 주는 밥 먹으면서

translation.en: then start bad-mouthing her.
Her food will choke you.
[in English] You just have eyes, you can't see.
-[in Yoruba] Please be quiet. -Nobody forced you to come here.
translation.ko: - 그럼 입 다물어 - 오라고 강요한 사람 없어

translation.en: Oh, then drag me out. Tell the security to throw me out.
translation.ko: 그럼 나 내쫓아 저기 경비한테 얘기해

translation.en: Don't spoil my mood, please.
So, ladies and gentlemen,
it would be nice for me to invite His Excellency, the Executive Governor,
who has supported and also enjoyed the tremendous support of women,
to join the celebrant and her friends on the dance floor.
translation.ko: 무대로 나와 오늘의 주인공 참석자분들과 함께할 겁니다

translation.en: Please let's welcome His Excellency Akinwale Razaq Onikoyi.
translation.ko: 아킨웨일 라작 오니코이 주지사님을 박수로 맞아주세요

translation.en: Please can we make some noise for his Excellency?
KT! Dude, your party is bumping, man.
Are you sure it's not time we go down to join them?
translation.ko: 우리가 가서 같이 안 놀아도 되겠어?

translation.en: Oh, you're welcome to, but you're on your own.
translation.ko: 당연히 가도 되지 근데 갈 거면 혼자 가

translation.en: Is that not Governor Onikoyi? And look at this man laughing and relaxed.
translation.ko: 저거 주지사 오니코이 아니야? 웃고 즐기는 거 보게

translation.en: Maybe I should go and pitch him one of my top-notch ideas.
translation.ko: 가서 내 아이디어 좀 어필해야 할까 봐

translation.en: Man, Kitan. Look, your mum has all these crazy connects
translation.ko: 기탄, 네 어머님 연줄이 장난 아닌데

translation.en: and you waste them.
It's not your fault, when lack of problem is your problem.
translation.ko: 네 잘못은 아니지 부족한 게 없으니까

translation.en: Have you guys seen Kemi tonight?
Yo, dude, your sister is fine.
Whose sister?
Mum was looking for you.
Whose mum?
Your mum or my mum?
translation.ko: 누나 엄마? - 아니면 우리 엄마? - 그만해, 키탄

translation.en: Fine, Kitan.
It would be great if you came downstairs to help
your mum receive guests and celebrate her birthday.
[MC] A loving mother to two lovely children
and the mummy of the whole community!
That's what we call her. At least, ladies and gentlemen,
translation.ko: 다들 이분을 이렇게 부르죠 신사 숙녀 여러분

translation.en: at this point, please permit me to welcome to the microphone,
translation.ko: 이쯤에서 오늘의 주인공을 마이크 앞으로 모시겠습니다

translation.en: the celebrant, for a few words.
Please let's put our hands together for...
KT, must you be such a jackass to her?
[MC] She's Mrs. Eniola Salami. My mummy!
-The mother of the whole community. -[applause]
Oh, what can I say?
Thank you very much.
Oh, my God.
Thank you for coming everybody. I--
Yes, as I was saying, thank you so much for coming.
Well, I don't know how to make speeches.
But I know it's not easy to gather people on a Tuesday for a party.
translation.ko: 그래도 화요일에 파티 온다는 게 어렵다는 건 알아요

translation.en: You honor me and may God honor you all.
Thank you so much. There's so much to eat and so much to drink.
translation.ko: 정말 감사합니다 음식과 술은 충분하니 즐기세요

translation.en: Thank you, once again. Be merry with me, please.
translation.ko: 다시 한번 감사드립니다 즐거운 시간 보내세요

translation.en: [MC] The celebrant, ladies and gentlemen!
Kemi, take care of my guests.
It's never a party without good music...
from the most versatile band, in the whole of Africa,
Akin Shuga and the Shuga Band.
I hope you people have not forgotten your promise.
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 약속한 거 잊지 않았으면 좋겠구나

translation.en: [MC] And I wanna tell you guys, if you're still sitting down...
translation.ko: 여러분께 말씀드리고 싶은 건 아직 앉아 계신다면...

translation.en: Senator, my mother didn't get where she is today
translation.ko: 의원님, 우리 엄마가 약속 안 지키는 분이셨으면

translation.en: by breaking her promises.
There's been no official appointment yet, so until then, we wait.
translation.ko: 공식적인 발표는 아직 안 났지만 기다려 봐요

translation.en: That's fine, that's fine.
But I just want to remind you that a deal is a deal
translation.ko: 그래도 일단 너한테 약속은 약속이란 걸 알려주려고

translation.en: and it won't be good if you break it.
translation.ko: 안 지키면 좋은 꼴은 못 볼 거야

translation.en: Remind?
With all due respect, Senator,
you of all people should know that my mother doesn't take kindly to threats.
translation.ko: 우리 엄마가 협박 싫어하는 거 의원님이 가장 잘 아시잖아요

translation.en: I'd be mindful not to tug the tail of the lion if I were you.
translation.ko: 저 같으면 잠자는 사자의 코털을 건드리지 않을 것 같네요

translation.en: We will get to you after the announcement has been made, as promised.
translation.ko: 공식 발표를 하고 나서 말씀드리죠 약속했던 것처럼요

translation.en: So until then, Senator, try to stay out of danger.
translation.ko: 그러니 그때까지는 위험한 짓 하지 마세요

translation.en: After all, Lagos can be a very dangerous city,
as you and your family must know. Enjoy the rest of the party, sir.
translation.ko: 의원님과 의원님 가족도 아실 텐데 즐거운 시간 보내세요

translation.en: [man whimpering] Boss, please.
Stand him up.
-[whimpering] -Stand up.
[in Yoruba] Look at me.
Look at me!
Have you eaten?
[in English] Nasco, why?
Are we barbarians here?
[in Yoruba] What's all that rubbish?
Please don't be offended.
[in English] I apologize on their behalf.
Sometimes, they don't know how to treat a friend.
translation.ko: 친구를 어떻게 대해야 할지 잘 몰라서 그랬을 거야

translation.en: [in Pidgin] You're my friend, right?
[in Yoruba] We are friends?
Very good.
[in Yoruba] Who sent you?
I said, who sent you?
Boss, please. They will kill me.
Really? So you think I'm the one here to play games with you?
translation.ko: 그래? 그럼 난 여기서 너랑 게임하는 거 같니?

translation.en: [in English] I'm going to ask you for the last time.
Who sent you people to kidnap Chief Davies' daughter?
translation.ko: 데이비 사령관 딸 납치하라고 널 보낸 사람이 누구냐고?

translation.en: Please have mercy, Boss.
I hate when people waste my time.
Clear the mess.
Aha, boys.
[in Yoruba] Ade Tiger will bring your food and drinks. Okay?
translation.ko: 아데 타이거가 음식이랑 술 갖다줄 거야

translation.en: Rice or Eba?
Either one, Boss.
How about pounded yam?
[in English] Good job. Well done, boys.
Sort this out.
[woman speaking Yoruba] What more do you want from me?
You're a stupid woman! I said you're a stupid woman!
translation.ko: 이 등신 같은 년! 너 진짜 등신 같다고!

translation.en: Get out of here!
-[woman] Leave me alone! -[man] I will deal with you!
[woman] You won't even let me feed well.
[woman] Eniola!
[woman in Yoruba] It's okay I met you this way.
What they said about you is who you really are.
translation.ko: 사람들이 당신에 대해 얘기했던 게 맞았어요

translation.en: King, please help me. This insult is becoming unbearable.
I called the police, they did nothing.
My daughter's boyfriend impregnated her and denied it.
translation.ko: 딸 남친은 딸애를 임신시키고도 아니라고 발뺌하고요

translation.en: Please have mercy on me. Help me fix this, please.
translation.ko: 자비를 베풀어주세요 이 일을 해결할 수 있게요

translation.en: Please help me.
[in English] Have you told him about the pregnancy?
Eh?
The boy responsible.
[in Yoruba] Yes, I told him. I went to see him.
If you see the way he treated me.
He insulted me,
my children and my family.
He belittled my daughter...
after humiliating her.
Please save me.
Mama... are you sure he's the one?
He's the one.
If you want me to swear in my child's name.
My child is very naive.
That's why he took advantage of her.
translation.ko: 그래서 그 남자애가 우리 딸을 이용한 거예요

translation.en: He has totally destroyed her life.
Mama, it's okay. Tears are not allowed here.
Take it easy
Mama.
[in Yoruba] I'm listening, King. I'm all ears.
-Mama. -[in Yoruba] I'm answering you.
[in English] I have a question for you.
I want you to think carefully before you answer me.
[in Yoruba] Please explain. Explain in detail.
[in Yoruba] I have question for you.
A week from today...
the young man...
and your child...
do you want them to get married?
Or do you want to hear news of his death?
translation.ko: 아니면 그 남자애가 죽는 게 좋겠어요?

translation.en: Which do you prefer?
What did you just say?
[in English] I will not repeat myself.
translation.ko: 난 두 번 얘기 안 해요

translation.en: [in Yoruba] Ah, what a pity.
What a pity. This man disgraced me.
translation.ko: 이럴 수가, 그 남자애가 이렇게 날 모욕하다니

translation.en: He disgraced and humiliated me! But it won't go that way.
translation.ko: 날 모욕하고 망신을 줬죠 이래선 안 돼요

translation.en: [in English] Mama. You have not answered my question.
translation.ko: 부인, 내 질문에 답 안 했어요

translation.en: [in Yoruba] Is that so?
King...
The deed has been done.
What else?
It's marriage.
-Ade. -Yes, King.
[in English] Take mama outside, get all the information needed.
translation.ko: 부인을 밖으로 모시고 필요한 걸 알려드려

translation.en: I personally, want you to sort this out immediately.
translation.ko: 개인적으로 이 일은 즉시 처리했으면 좋겠네

translation.en: -Yes, King. -Thank you.
Mama, this way.
-No need to thank me. -Thank you.
Mama, no need to thank me.
-Ah, I have to. It is needed. -[Ade] Mama.
I just want to thank you. Thank you.
translation.ko: 감사 인사 꼭 하고 싶어요 정말 고맙습니다

translation.en: -Don't worry. -[sighing]
-This way. -See my life. Thank you.
translation.ko: - 이쪽입니다 - 내 인생 봐요, 이건 감사하죠

translation.en: Market woman!
I'm answering you, King.
A week from now...
there will be an election.
Your living things...
and the non-living things...
male...
female...
they vote or not... we will win.
translation.ko: 투표해요, 안 하면... 어쨌든 우린 이길 거예요

translation.en: King, you can't send a gossip on an errand and she won't deliver.
translation.ko: 킹, 그렇게 말씀하신 거 제가 얘기할 필요도 없어요

translation.en: What you just said...
The young, old, male, female...
In fact, the whole market belongs to you.
You are in!
Do we still have people outside?
All the way down the street, mum.
Are you okay?
I'm tired.
I'm done for the day, baby.
[in Yoruba] Sorry.
Please take money, share it among them for their transportation and food.
translation.ko: 사람들한테 돈 나눠줘 차비 하거나 간식 사 먹으라고 해

translation.en: -Hmm? -Okay. Don't worry, mum. I'll handle it.
Thank you, baby.
[woman] This is the one I was telling you about, ma.
It will make you stand out very well.
It's very pretty. Mummy, see.
Mmm, yes. It's fine, but...
[in Yoruba] It's very expensive.
-Please let me look at something else. -[in Yoruba] Please don't say that.
translation.ko: - 다른 것도 좀 보자 - 그런 말 말아요

translation.en: You shall eat whatever you desire. You shall drink whatever you desire.
translation.ko: 먹고 싶은 거 먹고 마시고 싶은 거 마시고

translation.en: You shall wear whatever you desire, by God's grace.
translation.ko: 입고 싶은 거 입어야죠 신의 은총으로

translation.en: [in English] Just tell God, it is done. Are you the bride?
-Yes, ma. -Come here.
You are beautiful.
[in Yoruba] Ma'am! How many times will your daughter have a wedding?
translation.ko: 부인, 딸이 결혼을 몇 번이나 하겠어요?

translation.en: It's just once.
You have to make your in-laws see that your child is as precious as gold
translation.ko: 사돈이 봤을 때 따님이 반짝반짝 빛날 정도는 돼야죠

translation.en: and she's not ordinary.
Do you understand me?
-I understand but-- -There are no buts!
There are no buts in your life.
Give it to me.
There are no buts in your life. Can you come closer, my darling?
translation.ko: '하지만'은 안 쓰는 겁니다 아가씨, 이리 와봐요

translation.en: I will show you something.
Just look at this.
[in Yoruba] Ma'am, take a look. Give me your hand.
Feel that. Run it though.
Wow.
Feel that?
Can you feel that? Beautiful.
You see, this was handmade.
Everything you see here was hand-crafted. It is neck breaking labor.
translation.ko: 목이 부러져라 일하면서 일일이 손으로 만든 거죠

translation.en: I know what we're giving you.
[in Yoruba] May this child benefit from you.
[in English] Sweetheart, do you like it?
Yes, ma, it does really make my skin pop.
translation.ko: 네, 이거 입으니 얼굴이 사는 것 같아요

translation.en: Oh, my God! Pop!
[in Yoruba] You've got it spot on! Your daughter wants this badly.
translation.ko: 완전 꽂혔네 따님이 이거 아니면 안 되겠어요

translation.en: -You know what is good! -Good afternoon, ma.
Ah. Can you please go into my office?
When I'm done with my customer, I'll meet you in a minute, okay?
translation.ko: 손님하고 얘기 끝나면 바로 갈게, 알겠지?

translation.en: -Okay, ma. -Thank you.
[in Yoruba] Ah, thank you, my dear. What were we talking about?
Let me tell you something.
If you have money that covers the entire world
translation.ko: 전 세계를 사고도 남을 정도로 돈이 있어도

translation.en: and you don't spend it on your child.
It's all a waste.
If we die today, will the money be buried with us?
translation.ko: 오늘 죽으면 돈도 들고 갈 건가요?

translation.en: No.
Do you see this child?
I'm tapping into your grace.
I have two children. A boy and a girl.
translation.ko: 전 애가 둘이에요 아들 하나, 딸 하나

translation.en: And I am praying for a day like this.
I am praying for both a son-in-law and a daughter-in-law.
translation.ko: 사위랑 며느리 될 사람을 위해서도 기도하거든요

translation.en: So because of that, I will sow into your daughter's wedding.
translation.ko: 그러니까 따님 결혼식에 신경 좀 더 쓸게요

translation.en: -Huh? -Yes.
I know how much I bought this fabric and I know what my profit should be.
translation.ko: 이 원단 원가도 알고 얼마 남는지도 아니까

translation.en: My profit is 5% and I'll take it off. Just pay the cost price
translation.ko: 원래는 5% 남거든요 근데 할인해줄게요, 원가만 줘요

translation.en: [in English] Thank you so very much, madam.
You see, I didn't come expecting to spend that much.
[in Yoruba] Ah, what are you talking about?
If that's the situation, I have a POS machine.
Bring the machine!
You see, this store is yours.
Come in and take whatever you want. Do you understand?
Now I know you, and we've become family. Do you understand?
translation.ko: 이제 안면 텄으니 우린 가족이에요 알겠죠?

translation.en: [in English] Just make her happy. Make her happy, please.
Okay.
Thank you, Mummy.
Well done, well done.
I pray you enjoy it.
[in Yoruba] God will make it a day of joy for you.
Fantastic! Unfortunately, I have to leave you.
translation.ko: 너무 잘됐어요 아쉽지만 전 이제 가야겠네요

translation.en: I need to attend to the other guest.
Nneka, the shoe and bag, don't forget to show them.
Shoe and bag?
-[in Pidgin] Boss, you know what happened? -What happened?
translation.ko: - 보스, 무슨 일 있었는지 알아요? - 뭔데?

translation.en: That's what I was expecting from you! You have just been...
So, Boss, as I tried to position myself,
Do you understand me?
Oh, God. Bosco, speak.
It hurts that you guys weren't there to see what I did.
translation.ko: 너희들이 그때 내 활약을 못 봐서 진짜 아쉽다

translation.en: As soon as I charged...
they just kept looking at me and started bringing out their guns and grenades.
translation.ko: 계속 날 쳐다보다가 총이랑 수류탄 꺼내더라고

translation.en: I didn't have any weapons with me, but I stood my ground firmly.
The weed I was smoking before I left you guys just kicked into action
translation.ko: 내가 가기 전에 피운 대마초 때문에

translation.en: and everything switched to slow motion.
Then I attacked, and ten people fell.
As one tried to hit me in the chest, I countered the attack.
translation.ko: 한 명이 내 가슴을 치려고 했는데 내가 반격했어

translation.en: Then I hit him again.
Before I realized it, the 50 men were on the floor.
I didn't even have a scratch. Boss, take a look.
translation.ko: 근데 난 상처 하나도 안 났지 보스, 봐요

translation.en: -Bosco. -That's me.
The person who talks too much will definitely tell tall tales.
translation.ko: 말 많은 사람들이 하는 얘기는 거의 다 뻥이야

translation.en: Don't be upset, boss.
Hey!
-Odogwu Malay! -My people, I salute.
Maka Bariga. Baddest.
-My G. -Baddest, baddest, baddest. What's new?
-I'm good. -You're just shining.
What's up?
-Men everywhere. -That's right, that's right.
Now you've appeared in our hood, are we safe?
translation.ko: 자네도 우리 구역에 왔는데 안전한 건가?

translation.en: They say if a monkey puts on his sneakers and steps into the hood,
translation.ko: 원숭이가 운동화 신고 다른 구역에 가면

translation.en: there must be a mission.
I have something for you. You'll like what I brought.
translation.ko: 말할 게 있어, 맘에 들 거야

translation.en: Let's just convert here into a small office, quickly.
translation.ko: 우리끼리만 좀 얘기할까? 자리 좀 비켜줘, 어서

translation.en: So, what's up?
I just got back from Anambra.
My boys over there got some serious intel for us.
translation.ko: 거기 있는 우리 애들이 알려줄 게 있다더라고

translation.en: Remember my little brother, Dile?
Dile is really close to one of Ebele's boys here in Lagos.
translation.ko: 여기 라고스에 있는 에벨레 애들 중 하나랑 친하거든

translation.en: So, Dile told me that the man has about 10 million in his house.
translation.ko: 딜레가 그러는데 에벨레가 집에 천만 나이라를 숨겨놨대

translation.en: I was shocked, my brother.
10 million Naira?
What's up with you, Makanaki? 10 million Naira?
Did stealing 10 million Naira get us where we are? 10 million dollars!
translation.ko: 천만 나이라 가지고 되겠어? 천만 달러는 돼야지

translation.en: In a safe?
No way. Those types don't put money in safes anymore.
translation.ko: 아니지, 그런 녀석은 금고에 돈 안 넣어놔

translation.en: The bastard buried the money in a septic tank.
You know this whistle-blowing thing is opening doors like crazy.
translation.ko: 내부 고발자 있으면 문은 열린 거나 마찬가지잖아

translation.en: Put some money in the hands of these little boys and they'll start snitching.
translation.ko: 애들한테 돈만 좀 쥐어주면 다 얘기해줄걸

translation.en: The government gives five percent, but we give 10 percent, that's it.
Makanaki, you totally get it.
I even have bigger intel for you, Maka.
You know Number One? You know, Aare Akinwande.
Same thing, same thing, my guy.
So, if you have all this info, why did you bring it to me?
translation.ko: 그런 걸 다 알고 있는데 왜 나한테 온 거야?

translation.en: Because, Odogwu, I know you very well. You're not Santa Claus.
translation.ko: 내가 자네를 아는데 이유 없이 베풀진 않을 거란 말이지

translation.en: -Why did you bring this deal to me? -Maka, you're still learning.
translation.ko: - 왜 나한테 온 거야? - 마카, 아직 더 배워야겠네

translation.en: Maka, I'm a businessman. Fifteen percent of zero is zero, you know.
translation.ko: 난 사업하는 사람이야 빵원은 나눠도 빵원이잖아

translation.en: Here's what I want us to do, Makanaki. I want us to work together.
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 걸 알려주지 우리가 같이 일하는 거야

translation.en: I'm proposing a partnership. Let's work together.
Let's get in there and clear out this money from all three locations.
translation.ko: 가서 세 군데 있는 돈을 몽땅 쓸어오는 거야

translation.en: Maka, this cash will change our lives. Everything.
translation.ko: 마카, 이 돈이면 인생이 바뀌어 모든 게 바뀐다고

translation.en: If you think we're balling right now, this is where the real balling starts.
translation.ko: 지금 돈 있는 건 이거에 비하면 아무것도 아니야

translation.en: I'm telling you.
Fifty-fifty?
Yeah. You're my nigga, so fifty-fifty.
But that's after we have paid 40% to the King.
-Who? What's she doing in this deal? -Maka, you surprise me.
-What is her role in this deal? -Odogwu, please.
Her 40% must get to her whether she's involved in the deal or not.
translation.ko: 이 일에 관련이 있든 없든 킹한테는 40% 줘야 해

translation.en: Let's just pay her share and keep what's ours.
Please. This person in question.
When was the last time she brought anything to the table?
translation.ko: 킹이 마지막으로 쓸만한 걸 줬던 게 언제야?

translation.en: But she still eats from what we catch.
Odogwu, you won't open your eyes.
-But let's talk. -Okay.
[in English] What are you telling me?
Aare went back on his promise.
So what are you doing here?
translation.ko: 근데 넌 대체 왜 여기서 이러고 있어?

translation.en: Because I'm not a minister.
[scoffs] I am not a deputy governor, not even a bloody commissioner!
-Mum, calm down. -"Calm down?" Ha!
The governor just wants you to know that he tried his best, ma.
Can you listen to what this fool is telling me?
Listen to what this fool is saying to me!
So my money, my dollars,
all the money spent on this bastard election was for nothing?
translation.ko: 그 등신 새끼 선거에 쓴 내 돈이 다 무용지물이란 거야?

translation.en: It's not like that, ma. We really appreciate all you've done.
translation.ko: 그런 거 아니에요 도와준 건 고맙게 생각해요

translation.en: Then what exactly happened, Taiwo? This was a done deal.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었던 거죠, 타이오? 다 끝난 일이었잖아요

translation.en: -Ha! -Can I speak freely?
Speak.
Okay. Seems some of the party members are worried about...
your reputation, ma.
What? My reputation?
[in Yoruba] It will not be well with you.
[in English] You are mad. My reputation.
So when I was financing the movement, nobody spoke about reputation.
-Mum, calm down. -Don't tell me to calm down.
Aare wants to talk about reputation. Oh, ho! So, I'm the fool!
translation.ko: 아레가 평판을 논하시겠다! 그래, 내가 등신이지

translation.en: The moron that was doing their dirty work for them!
I will send you to Aare. Tell Aare that I, Eniola,
translation.ko: 아레한테 가서 똑똑히 말해 나, 에니올라가

translation.en: will take all my money.
All my blood, drop for drop.
-Ma? -Hey! Can you imagine?
They can't even come themselves. They sent you rat, to sit in my chair.
translation.ko: 직접 찾아올 용기도 없어서 너 같은 쥐새끼를 보내다니

translation.en: I think it's time you leave, Mr. Onitiri.
[man] Mama. Excuse me, ma.
Huh?
[man] Makanaki on the phone, ma.
What is it?
[man] Makanaki, on the phone.
What does he want?
Listen, I am tired and I am not ready for his trouble now.
translation.ko: 저기, 나 피곤하니까 마카나키 뒤치다꺼리는 못 해

translation.en: -Ma? -Hmm?
It seems very, very important.
-Korede. -Mama.
[in Yoruba] Good evening, ma. It's Makanaki speaking.
-Yes, what is it? How are you? -Fine, thank you, ma.
translation.ko: - 그래, 웬일이야, 잘 지내? - 네, 그럼요

translation.en: [in English] We need to see you. We have urgent things to talk about.
-What is it? -Business.
Ah. What kind of business?
[in Yoruba] Mama, it is wrong to use parables on elders.
translation.ko: 어르신한테 돌려 말하는 건 예의가 아니죠

translation.en: What other business do we discuss?
Please, we need to meet.
[in English] Korede, listen to me and listen good.
translation.ko: 코레데, 내가 하는 말 잘 들어

translation.en: I have enough on my plate
to get involved with your small, small play.
Just do the needful.
[in Yoruba] No ill wind must touch my people.
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 있어도 사람들 건드리면 안 돼

translation.en: Do you understand?
Pay me my tax, finish.
Other than that, I don't care.
-Take this. -Yes, ma.
Thank you.
-[man] Gobir. -Attention, sir!
I hope that you're finding everything satisfactory.
-Yes, sir. Fine. Really fine, sir. -That's good.
Nice, isn't it?
Very nice. Very nice, sir.
A gift from my new son-in-law.
-Amazing. -Yeah.
Let's get to it, sit down.
Thank you, sir.
You will not believe who we have in custody.
translation.ko: 우리가 누굴 잡았는지 알면 완전 놀랄걸

translation.en: -Who's that? -Eigbe.
-Eigbe? -And Rewane.
Ebele Rewane?
Senator Rewane.
Wow!
Both of them were using the National Petroleum Corporation
translation.ko: 둘 다 석유공사를 개인 금고처럼 쓰면서

translation.en: as a personal treasury, removing millions of dollars without conscience.
Anyway, they are both yours right now.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 지금 이 둘은 자네 담당이야

translation.en: -I want you to take their statements. -Okay, sir.
Make the necessary residence verifications.
-Yes, sir. -The press will be here anytime soon.
translation.ko: - 네 - 언론이 언제든 들이닥칠 수 있어

translation.en: Okay, sir.
How is your wife, Hauwa? I heard--
[in Hausa] Much better now, sir. No problem.
She's much better now.
[in English] In case you need anything, do let me know.
Okay, sir. I will.
[TV announcer] It's morning in Africa...
[man] Aare is in a meeting with the party chairman
in the main living room.
He has asked me to make you feel comfortable
until he is ready to join you.
Please have a seat, ma.
-[Kemi] Thank you. -Thank you.
[news anchor] The senate today confirmed the appointment of Nurudeen Gobir
as the new head of NCCC's special financial crimes department.
Speaking at a news conference, Nurudeen Gobir thanked his supervisors...
translation.ko: 회의에서 누루딘 고비르는 상원의원들에게 감사를 전하며

translation.en: -[man] Can I get you something to drink? -No, thank you.
translation.ko: - 마실 것 좀 드릴까요? - 아니, 됐어요

translation.en: ...promising to execute his duties with virtue and honesty.
translation.ko: 성실하고 정직하게 임무를 다할 것을 약속했습니다

translation.en: Actually, can I have a glass of cold water?
[man] Yes, ma.
[news anchor] Gobir's appointment is the latest in efforts
translation.ko: 고비르가 임명된 건 최근 조직을 새롭게 개편하려는

translation.en: for the organization to clean up its image, after...
Let's set up. Time is 8:25. No, 8:26 now.
[in Pidgin] I've set it.
The match will start at 10:01 on the dot.
And the match will end at exactly 11:31.
If Arsenal isn't in the championship by then, they're on their own. We're out.
translation.ko: 아스널이 그때까지 챔피언전 못 가면 알아서 해, 우린 빠진다

translation.en: We'll be there. Don't worry, we'll be there.
translation.ko: 갈 테니 걱정하지 마 그때까지 가

translation.en: [news anchor] Gobir's disgraced predecessor...
[man] Eniola!
[chuckles] Eniola! Good girl.
-Good evening, sir. -How are you?
Ah! Who is this? Ah!
Is this not Adekemi of yesterday? That used to look like a boy.
translation.ko: 어제 있었던 아데케미구나 옛날엔 남자애 같더니

translation.en: -[chuckles] -Ah, the work of God,
you cannot find it even if you look for it.
Look at how God has put everything one by one
in every place and everything is perfection. Ah!
translation.ko: 눈, 코, 입이 아주 완벽하네 제대로야

translation.en: [in Yoruba] She is our daughter.
Stand up. Stand up and sit down.
-Thank you, sir. -Ah, ah. Welcome. Sorry.
[news anchor] The Nigerian government
has officially signed its whistle-blower policy
which encourages citizens
to report suspected financial crimes to the authorities.
translation.ko: 의심스러운 금융 범죄를 당국에 고발할 수 있는 제도죠

translation.en: The policy put in place
in conjunction with the Attorney General, the federation and the Ministry of Justice
offers five percent of all moneys recovered to whistle-blowers,
irrespective of amount.
Imagine the rubbish. Huh? Imagine this rubbish.
translation.ko: 쓰레기 같은 정책이야 저게 말이 되냐?

translation.en: They are encouraging criminals to harass us
and to blackmail us.
Huh? Is this the reason why we put him there?
translation.ko: 저러라고 우리가 저 자리에 꽂아준 거 아니라고

translation.en: Why we appointed him as president? Huh?
translation.ko: 왜 저 사람을 대통령으로 앉힌 거야?

translation.en: It's the "Corruption today, corruption tomorrow,
corruption, corruption everywhere!"
Is that what we are going to be eating?
Huh? What is all of that?
Ah, ah. Festus, these are special guests. How could you bring water for them?
translation.ko: 페스투스, 특별한 손님인데 물이 뭐냐, 물이?

translation.en: No, no, sir. I actually, I requested the water, sir.
-Ah? You wanted water? -Yes, sir.
Okay, you can go. You can go.
-[in Yoruba] Sorry. -Thank you, sir.
-[in English] You're welcome. -Thank you, sir.
Um... Mum, I'll just go sort out that thing I told you about.
translation.ko: 엄마, 전 가서 아까 말씀하신 거 처리하고 올게요

translation.en: Sorry, sir, excuse me.
Ah, the work of God.
[chuckles] Eniola.
-Sir? -Let us get back to why you are here.
-Hmm? -Yes, sir.
But before you say anything, let me tell you--
translation.ko: 일단 아무 말 말고 들어 봐

translation.en: Personally, I, personally,
I know how-- I know about your... [in Yoruba] What is it called?
translation.ko: 난 다 알지, 자네의... 그걸 뭐라 그랬더라

translation.en: [in English] This thing from inside... Agitation!
I know about your agitations and your concern.
translation.ko: 자네가 불안하고 뭘 신경 쓰는지 다 알아

translation.en: I know how you feel.
I know how you feel.
Hmm? You see, if I tell you
that you are a very important part of this our movement,
translation.ko: 우리가 그린 큰 그림에서 자네가 엄청 중요하다고 하면

translation.en: you have to believe me.
Yes, you must believe me.
You're my person. You're my child.
Huh? So when I tell you to be patient,
I know exactly what I am talking about.
translation.ko: 내가 다 알고 하는 말이니 그러려니 해

translation.en: You see, it is all about timing. Simple timing.
translation.ko: 다 타이밍 문제야 간단한 타이밍 문제

translation.en: That is why the elders of the party, they have said that,
we need to, uh... we need to keep you aside, uh,
until the next, uh, election.
Ministerial appointment, that is not for you now.
translation.ko: 장관 임명은 약속할게 지금은 때가 아니야

translation.en: You see what we are planning is big. It is bigger!
translation.ko: 우리가 큰 그림을 그리고 있거든 엄청 큰 그림

translation.en: We're talking about power. Real power!
translation.ko: 진짜 권력을 얘기하는 거야 막강한 권력

translation.en: So you just have to be patient, because, you see, we...
What we're trying to do right now is...
to clean up in our heads,
this idea that you are from another world.
translation.ko: 자네가 다른 세상에 있었다는 그 인식 있잖아

translation.en: -Sir? -You see, because-- Eh?
What do you mean by "different world," sir?
With all due respect.
-Eniola. -Sir?
[in Yoruba] Don't take it personal.
-[in English] This is politics. -No, sir.
-Look at-- -No, no, no sir. I just want to know.
Is it this same world that has financed
more than 30 state elections in this country since 1999?
translation.ko: 자금을 지원한 게 다른 세상에 사는 거예요?

translation.en: Eniola--
Or the world you call upon whenever you need muscle?
translation.ko: 아니면 어깨가 필요할 때마다 찾는 게 다른 세상인가요?

translation.en: Or when they said that Aare could no longer deliver the south
or Aare could no longer arrange the streets...
Who did you run to?
Who did you come to for help?
Me!
Me, Eniola! And what happened?
People came out!
People came to support you!
Who had the power of the south?
Who had the power of the East?
Eniola, don't get upset for no reason.
translation.ko: 에니올라 별거 아닌 거로 화내지 마

translation.en: Don't, baba! Don't go there!
[in Yoruba] Don't even go there. Sir, don't!
Take a good look at me.
The locust bean said
that it had never felt insulted
until it reached Okemesi,
where it was called a tick.
Eniola! Have you forgotten?
Have you forgotten the presence of whom you are standing?
translation.ko: 네가 지금 누구 앞에 서 있는지

translation.en: Have you forgotten the presence of whom you are?
It is I, Aare!
Whatever I say cannot be questioned,
translation.ko: 내 말에 토 다는 건 있을 수 없는 일이야

translation.en: whatever I do can never be questioned.
translation.ko: 내 행동에 토 다는 것도 그렇고

translation.en: My word is law.
Ah, Eniola?
Sir.
I apologize, sir.
I was out of line.
Sit down.
Ah, ah, Eniola.
-[in English] Sir. -You have to be patient. Eh?
You have to be patient. The things that I have planned for you.
translation.ko: 조금만 기다리면 돼 널 위해 계획하는 게 있다고

translation.en: It's bigger than you think.
But you won't be patient. You will not be patient.
translation.ko: 근데 지금 못 기다리잖아 참기 힘들지

translation.en: Look, what if we start like this, because we are family, we're one.
translation.ko: 그렇다면 이건 어때? 우린 가족이고 하나잖아

translation.en: What if we start by taking one of your children,
and make him or her the Deputy Commissioner for,
translation.ko: 아들이든 딸이든 상관없이 부청장으로 임명하는 거야

translation.en: say, Agriculture in Lagos State?
This your boy, what's his name?
-Kitan. -Yes, Kitan!
If we make Kitan the Deputy Commissioner for Agriculture in Lagos State,
translation.ko: 우리가 키탄을 라고스주 농산부 부청장으로 임명하면

translation.en: that will prove to you that we are one family. Eh?
translation.ko: 우리가 하나라는 걸 믿을 수 있겠나?

translation.en: Thank you very much, sir.
Ah, the things we have in store for you is bigger than that.
translation.ko: 지금 계획하는 건 그것보다 훨씬 큰 거야

translation.en: But you have to wait.
Thank you, sir.
It's all right. It's okay.
But, sir, can we... put Adekemi instead?
translation.ko: 근데요... 아들 대신 아데케미를 임명해도 될까요?

translation.en: Because Kitan just got back, and he has not really settled.
translation.ko: 키탄은 온지 얼마 안 돼서 아직 적응 중이에요

translation.en: If it is Adekemi you want, we will do that.
-That is it, Adekemi will become. Huh? -Thank you, sir.
-[in Yoruba] It's done! -Thank you, sir.
Eniola, stand up, stand up.
Eniola. Ah.
-Don't forget yourself. -Yes, sir.
-You must not forget yourself. -Yes, sir.
Hello, sis.
-[in Hausa] Hello. -Hello, Aisha.
[in English] I wanted to come to the hospital after work today
but the children, you know, they have lessons and they were really hungry.
translation.ko: 애들 때문에, 알지? 학원도 가고 밥도 해줘야 해서

translation.en: It's fine. It's okay, You don't have to.
Did you get the costing from the hospital in India?
translation.ko: 인도 병원에서 비용 처리한 거 받았어?

translation.en: Yes, I did. They sent it to me.
[in Hausa] Okay. How much is it?
[in English] No, Hajia, don't worry yourself.
translation.ko: 그러지 마, 걱정 안 해도 돼

translation.en: I'll find a way to get it.
Please, let me know how we can help.
translation.ko: - 내가 방법을 찾아볼게 - 부탁이야 어떻게 도와주면 될지 알려줘

translation.en: You are taking care of my children, and that is so much of a help.
translation.ko: 우리 애들 보고 있는 게 도와주는 거야

translation.en: Honestly.
Good night, Aisha.
